Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovating”
Reviews.Author: BelgianInIstanbul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before as it quite convenient location for me, close to places I need to be, and also (as most hotels of course) not far away from metro station. It is situated in a quite busy neighbourhood, but the street itself is rather quiet. I write again about it, as it has improved a lot with the ongoing renovation. The rooms which were indeed quite worn out, are now in nice grey and bordeaux colours, and also the bathroom is receiving complete makeover with white and grey dominating there. A large walk-in shower, small vanity mirror and also hairdryer. Free wifi with code (also in the rooms thus) makes it also convenient place to stay. The renovation is not complete yet. I stayed mid March, half of 3th floor was done, and all the floors above, so ask to be in renovated rooms. Breakfast is acceptable for this hotel category: 2 / 3 types of cheeses and meat, scrambled eggs, sausages and bacoon, fresh fruit salad and fresh fruits, with also of course viennoiseries and bread, yoghurt, some bio products,...

Reviews.Title: “title”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although easybooking made a mistake with our booking, the hotel staff toke complete care of us. The hotel was very clean and pleasant to stay. Nice quiet location in the center, close to everywhere. Good restaurants in the earia. A very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “A rather tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter M Grant Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not the usual standard of Mercure, a rather tired old hotel with relatively little attention to detail. Stair carpets showed same biscuit crumbs after 3 days! Breakfast quite good for Paris and free WiFi an advantage. OK for a short business stay, no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “nice remake of rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed two good nights of sleep and two days of solid client meetings. Hotel being remodeled, we had remodeled room on top floor so no noise. Very comfortable bed, Nice shower. Good location for work and enjoyment. Breakfast was standard. Bar area needs a redo but staff quite attentive to all requests. Found price to be competitive for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In overall, good location, near Metro station, lots of restaurants and a small Carrefour nearby. It takes around 10 mins walk to Printemp and La Fayette Department stores, very convenient. But, there is no big room for 3 persons, or even no extra bed can be added. Room space is not very big, if you carry the big luggage, there will be no space for walk thru.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel at a good location with small bedrooms but a big breakfast. So you don't need more for a city visit. +: wifi access / breakfast / location but quiet -: small rooms (which is normal in paris) / rooms little bit oldfashioned

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located in a quiet street but very close to a metro and bus stops. Good restaurants in the neighbourhood. The rooms were small but completely adequate. There was a large choice for breakfast and the staff were friendly and attentive. The girls at Reception were also friendly and very helpful. There was plenty of information available for guests wishing to take excursions and to visit the sights. There were six of us in our group so it was nice to be able to sit in the small but cosy lounge for a nightcap and chat before going up to our rooms. Luckily no-one else had the same idea! The Reception area could do with a face lift because that's the first thing one sees on entering the hotel. An ideal hotel for a short city break. Good value for money. Will certainly return. Thank you for a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Currently undergoing refurbishment. Stayed in a 6th floor refurbished room - modern style decor, very clean and comfortable. Not an easy location to find, small side street not labelled on all maps. Great location for walking to Opera and Galleries Lafayette for shopping. Reception staff very helpful. Folies Bergere and many restaurants on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a real neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tuf
Reviews.Content: If you like to get an idea of where real Parisians live, the Monty is in a good spot. The closest metro stop (Grand Boulevards) is about a 5 minute walk, and along the way there's plenty of decent little bistros, pharmacies, grocery stores, etc. Decent reception area (typical 2-3 star style) with some comfortable sitting areas, and a small elevator. The rooms are small but in good shape, with very good bathrooms. Our room was a double with a street view, with enough room to walk comfortable around the bed and a decent sized desk and closet. The bathroom was a standout; full sized tub with a real shower, a big sink, and nice and clean. The room had A/C but it mysteriously shut off randomly at night. If you open the window to compensate you get all the noise from the street and at the time of this review there was serious construction going on all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and service below average”
Reviews.Author: Aladin007
Reviews.Content: Some rooms are very small with limited place for clothes. I managed to change my room for a better one on the street only thanks to the maid's kind help as the reception wrongly informed me that the hotel was full. Some of the reception shift are very unfriendly. Not the kind of service you would expect from Accor. Internet is long. Average breakfast although quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and shappy cmmon areas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was in a room on the first floor. Everytime someone else in the hotel flushed the loo, you could hear water coursing through the pipes. The A/c in my room didn't work and although the room was small but very clean and with modern furnishings, the common areas of the hotel are in desperate need of a freshen up. All in all, I did not feel that it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Une critique positive”
Reviews.Author: Pulcebella Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Helpful Reception staff – especially Hamid. No matrimonial bed as reserved - we tied the legposts together! They offered to change the room the next day, but for a smaller room. The renovated room was lovely in design and colour scheme - but a woman should have tested it under normal travel conditions! No drawers for intimate clothing and not a single chair! There were only 6 hangers for 2 adults. Travelled in August and still the bedding was the type used in the Alps in winter – we asked for a top sheet instead of the "eiderdon type" bed covering. Air conditioning was insufficient as it was centrally controlled to save energy! We complained but they couldn't do anything about it. Our door banged lougdly when closing – same thing for the other new doors. Suggested to adjust the doors’ pressure closing system as it will eventually ruin the hinges! Beautiful bathroom with a huge Victorian type bathtub, but no shower drape - water splashing everywhere and if you don't have a 10/10 body, you've got to lock yourself have some privacy. There isn’t any ventilation in the bathroom making it very warm after 2 showers , and smelly after hubby's passage.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad and not so good.”
Reviews.Author: juncool
Reviews.Content: The hotel stands in ...au millieu ...in the middle of the central. 1) For getting there by foot (by taking train) it takes a quite time w/ a suitcase. it would be a hard work. Streets are narrow and it's not easy to give the space to the others. 2) Service, When we arrived the hotel, it was closed...unless it was ca. at 20 o'clock. Clicked the button to connect the reception...nobody... 10-20 mins later the reception came and opened the door. The reception was not friendly at all and just did what she had to do for the guests. Well. understood French style for the hotel service, mais ce n'est pas sympa! 3) Hotel room was OK 4) Conclusion: It would be a quite expensive compared with the price. My friends stayed in the other hotel, which was very closed to this hotel and the prices weren't not different. Their receptions were friendly even we were not guests of theirs.

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is near Subway and at walking distace of The Louvre e.t.c. The bathroom was normal sized and everything was clean and well maintained. However, the room was very small and the bed was much to small and to soft. There was a painting going on on the floor right above the room, so jelling of men, slamming of doors and the sound of a paint mixer from 08.00 on. There were constuctions outside on the street so this also made noise. We stayed 6 nights and stayed only to sleep in the hotel so this was a also a bit of a downside. I stayed a lot in Ibis hotels and felt that this was more of an Ibis then a Mercure. I paid with discount but i feel full price for the size of the room and bed too much. If you get it at a discount rate this Hotel is adequate, if not try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Mermoz20
Reviews.Content: Very nice welcome by the night shift manager (arrival around midnight). Nice renovated room (they are starting by the top floor and will refurbish the entire hotel). Perfect breakfast buffet with lots of choice. Very friendly people. Will go back, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bromberek Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was a perfect location for walking or taking the metro all over the city. The rooms are small but nothing out of the ordinary for Europe. My friend and I had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had phonecall the night before to say they had not received payment (although later proved they had) and they had put us in the local Holiday Inn (that was still being built). Hotel is in a nice area of Paris but on this occasion their service severely let them down.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Assume "Mercure" standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First of all I am big fun of Accor group. It looks "joined Accor-group" not the original and not refurbished yet. As you realised, room is not changed from previous hotel (I do not know previous owner-era but we could know) only Accor-system had been installed. If you imagine "Mercure" standard, you might be disappointed but just assume 15 yrs-old non-refurbish hotel, it would be acceptable. Please note, location, one of the best place in Paris, line 7, 8, 9 are available and Nord station, famous shopping stores are walkable-reach. Not for business but might be for leisure. Fre-Wifi, very good connection same as other Accor.

Reviews.Title: “the worst valur for money i ever find in life”
Reviews.Author: stephbtoulouse Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i travel all year long all over the world, but this is by far the worst value i ever had ! for 3 days i paid 745eur without breakfast for an incredibly crappy small old rooms. The location is good, the entrance is big, but the room are just incredible. I would have been happy for 80eur (yes in paris room at 80eur) so one advice: avoid it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in the 9th district, close to metro lines and shopping areas. The room we had had been renovated (apparently only a few have been redone). The room was very small with barely any space to store clothing. The bathroom only had a shower and was very tiny (barely any space to move in the shower) and the shower nozzle was already broken... I have stayed in other Mercure Hotels before and for this price, this hotel was a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and centrally located in a quiet back street off the main boulevard”
Reviews.Author: levado
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful at reception when I checked in, and kept my luggage for later collection on check-out. The hotel's situated in a quiet neighbourhood a couple of streets behind the busy bustling boulevards of central Paris. There are plenty of bars, small stores and restaurants in neighbouring streets, including Jewish businesses and antiques/auctioneer shops. The hotel is a short 10-15 minute walk from the Gare du Nord railway station. In fact large parts of Paris are walkable from this central location. The only downside was that the shower was a bit narrow with limited room to move. Otherwise the room, though small, looked as if it had been totally renovated, with a brown decor including taffeta curtains and nicely upholstered chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good bet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located and very close to the Grand Boluevard Metro station. The staff was very helpful. I was pleasantly surprised that the internet connection is free. The rooms though a little small are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay with slight disapointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very warm inside room and air conditioning was off (because of the season) despite any prior notice about that. Insisted by the reception but nothing was done. In general room was ok, but quite small. Bed was also quite small for 2 people and believe was not the right value for such conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: There really isn't anything spectacular to say about this hotel. Everything is fairly average. The location is really good though - it's just a couple of blocks from the Grands Boulevards stop on Line 9. Most of the main attractions in central Paris are about a 30-minute walk in any direction. The check-in staff was average. The elevator going up to the room is tiny - it only holds about 3 people comfortably without luggage. The good thing is that there are stairs right next to the elevator. The rooms are extremely small! We had two twin beds in our room that were right next to each other, and there was about a one foot gap around the bed and the surrounding wall. The walls are paper thin, so you can hear what your neighbors are doing. There is a small closet in the corner with a safe. There is also a desk in the room with a flat-panel television on top of it. The beds were not very comfortable. The restroom was average. The shower head is adjustable, but the knob that holds the head in place would never hold, so I found myself washing myself up against the wall. There is a shaving mirror in the bathroom as well, but the screws were loose, so I couldn't hold the mirror where I wanted it to be. There are better hotels in Paris, but if you're looking for something at a reasonable price, this place isn't so bad.

Reviews.Title: “peut mieux faire”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast: excellent Room: small and hot with cental heating at 0 bathroom : nozy ( shower at midnight) parking: null ! was full without any information at each level

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Melb1985
Reviews.Content: I read so many bad reviews on trip advisor and was a little cautious about staying at the Mercure Opera but im glad i choose to stay in the end. I was given a room on the 4th floor, room 402, which was of course quite small being very typical of paris BUT the room had recently been renovated to a very high standard, the bed was super comfortable, the heating was perfect, and the bathroom was something i would see in a luxury hotel. it really was a great room! and to make things even better the hotel offered free WiFi! The staff at reception were very friendly and helped me out with any question that i had on the city. i never ate in the restaurant so i cant comment on the restaurant. Im guessing they perhaps are still going through the renovation process though so it might be worth asking if they have a renovated room just in case when you arrive to ensure you do get one that isnt old.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't actually stay here due to problem with room - weren't notified!”
Reviews.Author: LukewarmCatastrophe
Reviews.Content: As the title says, we didn't actually end up staying here. Bizarrely we turned up to check in, were greeted with smiles from staff who spoke decent English who looked all set to check us in, then there was a covert conversation in French and all of a sudden, there was a problem with our room so we had to move to the other Mercure Hotel which was thankfully just 2 doors down from this one. Not sure what the problem was (when we arrived, we noticed there seemed to be a problem with the Parisian sewerage system in the immediate vicinity of the hotel - there were huge plumes of water spewing out of the drains in the ground outside so perhaps that was a reason?) We weren't try to check in early or anything like that, it was after 2pm! Anyway, it wasn't a problem - the Mercure Paris Lafayette Hotel that we were moved into was literally next door and actually had better reviews and a more expensive rack rate, so we benefited if anything. I've knocked this hotel down a few notches because of the lack of prior notification of there being a problem with a room. A phone call might have been nice? But otherwise, it's unfair of me to review this hotel on its services when I didn't get to experience them. The receptionist did walk us to the other hotel and explain to the receptionist in there what the problem was, so I'll praise her for that. Please read my review of the Mercure Paris Lafayette Hotel for more details.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: LisaK_511
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the 9th arrondissement, just a short walk away from the Opera and the shopping district. I wouldn't advise this hotel though if, like us, you are travelling by car, as the parking garage is a five minute walk from the hotel (with luggage as there is no way to park anywhere near the hotel, even for a minute) and very expensive. We had asked for two communicating family rooms and told on the phone this wouldn't be a problem but upon arrival, we were told we would have to be on different floors. When asked whether they could do sometyhing about it, the head receptionist refused and was very curt and unfriendly. The rooms are very small and have seen better days: a lot of scaling paint in the bathroom, very hard beds and a carpet in dire need of a cleanup. Not a problem because we were only staying one night but I would definitely not recommend it for a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Big on location; small on size”
Reviews.Author: TravelManGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I chose a Mercure hotel having enjoyed my stay at one in Budapest where I felt it was good value, good food and comfortable. The Mercure Paris Monty Opera is in a very good location - we found it easily from the Metro Grand Boulevards, having got there from the Gare du Nord (changing Metro lines at Strasbourg St Denis). Nice reception area and staff very helpful. As detailed in other reviews, though, I can concur that the rooms are very small which I surmise is an issue with many hotels in Paris. The decor wasn't inspiring either. The bathroom on the other hand was a reasonable size but stepping in and out of the bath to take a shower was somewhat perilous because the positioning of the sink did not allow the shower screen to open. It wasn't a problem for me - but not recommended if you're slightly infirm. They would have been much better just having a walk-in shower. I can't understand why hotels insist on a bath because no-one I know ever wants to lie in a hotel bath! We didn't sleep particularly well because the room got very hot in the middle of each of our four nights and you had to throw off the bedclothes to cool down. Needless to say, an hour or so later, you woke up again because it was too cool! Breakfasts were very good - bacon, scrambled egg, boiled egg and bacon available each morning and good choice of cereals, fruit, meats and cheese plus pastries, juice and jams. Late breakfast till 11at weekend and bank holidays and to 10.30 weekdays. We had a great time in Paris and we did like the hotel in many ways but the issues with the room mean were not insignificant. Next time we come to Paris, we'll either save up and pay for a more spacious room - guess it would need to be a 4 star - or stick with a Mercure-type hotel but stay outside the heart of the city where rooms may be larger and you can still easily get into the centre by Metro

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Mercure Monty”
Reviews.Author: br��silienne
Reviews.Content: I've booked the Mercure Monty to use during the delay between my rent apartment checkout and my night flight (from 11 AM to 4 PM). It was enough to know that this is a terrible place. Old furniture, smell of smoke, shower drain clogged. As it was just for a few hours, I haven't look for tripadvisor's reviews and booked directly from accor hotels website, looking for low rates. What a mistake! This was my 6th trip to Paris and I've tried Paris Perfect's apartment, Ibis Cambronne, Arvor Saint Georges, Grandes Hommes and Hameau du Passy. If you are looking for low rates, I absolutely recommend Ibis or Hameau instead of Mercure Monty.

Reviews.Title: “Cat swinging not advised”
Reviews.Author: Tum22
Reviews.Content: Good location near Folies Bergeres but do not confuse with the now defunct Mercure near Grands Boulevards Metro - the signs are still up and illuminated at night - surely Mercure could have taken then down by now. Room adequate for a one night stay but would not advise any longer as very tiny and stuffy. Breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Before you book be warned”
Reviews.Author: jacandy
Reviews.Content: Before you book, be warned that they may choose to not refund any money to you if you are not able to make your booking and have to cancel. I was looking forward to staying with this group, but unfortunately something came up. I gave two weeks notice to advise that i would have to cancel our booking, to which i promptly received a reply stating that we would not get a refund and did we wish to go ahead and cancel. The reply was quite rude and seemed indicitave of the service we would have received, had we stayed. I then replied stating that i would like to stay in their hotel hopefully at a later date and i was happy to negotiate that they could keep 50% based on the inconvienance, but hopefully we would book with them in the future. To this day we still have not received a reply ( a week and a half ) which is very disappointing as they were very quick to advise us that they were keeping our money, even though we didnt use any of the service. Basically this is the easiest $1250 AUD they have made, without care or thought of any customer service. Yes rules are rules, however we are meant to be guests, i dont want all the money back but just a portion as they are getting money for nothing, and we may have selected to use their service close in the future. This has just made up our decision that we are not going to ever use their service again, it's just legal theft, and they obviously have no customer service

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFinland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monty Opera for one week in June 2008. We = 2 adults + one 2 year-old child. We had nice triple room, quite small, but normal european size. The room was clean, but a bit worn out. The staff in the hotel were great, always smiling and helpful. And regarding our youngster, he was very well noticed. We had no problem with security, we had own safe in the room, and used it too. The room was quite quiet in the nighttime, as long as nobody flushed the toilet, and almost everyone were discreet enough not to do that. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodieD
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel near the boulevard italieen. The receptionist re very helpful,we arrive very late in the night and no problem at all!! the room are very little but very nice with a goo view. jodie

Reviews.Title: “small rooms great location”
Reviews.Author: shinyhappy
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in double room at this hotel. Rooms small bathroom tiny. Both were cleaned daily though. Tea and coffee making facilities in room. Had great view of Folies Bergere from room. Street below could be noisy early am with rubbish collection. Otherwise perfect safe location. Easy walking access to Sacre Coeur, Louvre, Notre Dame. Grand Boulevard Metro line just around corner for easy commute to Eiffel Tower etc if legs too tired! Loved Paris however my watch went missing!!!?? Had a bad experience also at the Eiffel Tower, when at cafe on 2nd floor i was handed a plastic cup of scalding hot coffee!!! Needless to say i burned my hand and spilled coffee. Staff response....handed me a cloth to clean it!! When i asked for cold water to pour over burn i was asked if i wished to buy a bottle!! Was utterly disgusted and no offer of help or even a further coffee was given. Found service in most restuarants etc very poor but refused to allow this to spoil my experience. Would recommend hotel which although a bit dated is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Mercure Paris Monty Opera”
Reviews.Author: terrencetravel
Reviews.Content: stayed at Mercure Monty Opera from Aug 4, 07 to Aug 8, 07. I had a very terrible experience in the hotel. On Aug06, at around 11:00p.m., when I got back to the hotel room, RM210, I found that my suitcase was moved onto my bed and my personal stuff, i.e, my clothes and skin care products were all over my bed. Then I checked the lock of my suitcase and found that it was broken and my new purchased things, 1 Louis Vuitton wallet and 2 pairs of Chanel earrings which valued 550 Euro, were missing. My companion found her iPod and Ray-Ban sunglasses were missing too. I immediately went to the front desk with my companion and reported the loss. The Night Manager then went to our room with us and checked what happened. He, my companion and, I found the lock of the door had not been broken, but the door, itself could not close automatically. The night manager called the Hotel Manager, Gonin Sylvie and advised us to talk to her the next day. Then my companion and I went to police station to declare loss. In the next morning, we met Sylvie, the hotel manager. We told her what happened once again and asked for compensation. However, she said she could not give us money back at that moment, but photocopied all of the receipts and declaration form from the police and sent all the documents to the insurance company. We suspected that our stuff was stolen by the staff in the hotel as the door of our room was never been broken. Therefore, we asked her if she could investigate and talked to her staff. However, she said her staff had been working in the hotel for many years but similar cases never happened before so she did not think her staff did it. I am very disappointed on how the Hotel Manager handled this case. She never tried to find out the truth, never checked the cameras and the staff, but only sent my documents to the insurance company and fixed the door. That's all!! I really doubt that was the appropriate handling procedure for a stealing case in a well known hotel group. I was very uncomfortable staying in Monty Opera and obviously the tragedy occurred to me was the fault made by the hotel, but still, I had to pay for 225 Euro. Up to this point, I still haven't received any update on this case from the hotel nor even 1 dollar of compensation. Therefore, I urge Accor group can follow the whole case up for me with Mercure Monty Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Monty”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, with lots of light and a nice private balcony wih view over the roofs of Paris. The Monty is centrally located close to several Metro stops and bus stops which makes it convenient to explore the city. Staff was nice and welcoming. I would mostly recommend it for tourists as room space is limited for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Baggio925
Reviews.Content: I am a Hong Kong Citizen. I have already visited paris with my gf from 28 Sep to 5 Oct and we stayed our 7 nights in this hotel. It is excellent!!! I don't know why others said the rooms are small......It is a 3 stars hotel in Europe. For its size, it should be rated as 4 star as well!! The place are clean indeed. They provide breadfast buffet with good quality. The mini bar is nice too. It is in a very very convinent site. It is near the metro station and there are so many different kind of resterants nearby with acceptable costs of food. The security is good. For my past experience in Europe, I can place my baggage in the store rooms at the day I check out, however, the room are all free to go in and go out. Everybody can goes in and gets your baggage. But in Mecure opera, the store room is locked all the time. Only the staff can have the key to open the knock and only they can go into the room. They will put a name tab at the handrail of your baggage. Then the baggage can only be picked after idenitfying yourself to the staff. Moreover, the staff are really really helpful, though not all of them can speak in English. One little thing to point out, there is a young lady in the staff who is excellent pretty and lovely. Though she cannot speak English, she is willing to help and talk with anyone. I usually went downstair to gossip with her (limited words of course) when my gf was showering!!.....^o^

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: liban0214
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are very small, but after all this is Paris and that is normal. The location is great. the metro is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. A lot of shopping and restaurants by the hotel. Very close to major attractions. The staff is great and helpful. Safe neighborhood. Negatives: very small rooms. rooms in hotel are very close to each other. Given size of the hotel, it can very crowded. Positives: Great neighborhood. Close to major attractions. Close to metro. Clean

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: A small but very good hotel in a great location. Rooms are not to small - given this is Paris. The service and the bar are very nice. The location is excellent with the Grands Boulevards right at your doorstep which gives you lots of dining, entertainment and shopping options very close by. There is however only one very small elevator which can get crowded at times. We did't mind even though we were on a high floor - but be prepared to either wait or walk the stairs.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Paris Monty Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 5 rue de Montyon, 75009 Paris, France
